  16. /* Operations on weak arrays */

  18. #ifndef CAML_WEAK_H
  19. ‌#define CAML_WEAK_H

  21. #include "mlvalues.h"
  22. #include "memory.h"

  24. #ifdef __cplusplus
  25. extern "C" {
  26. #endif
  27. extern value caml_ephe_none;

  29. #ifdef CAML_INTERNALS

  31. ‌struct caml_ephe_info {
  32.   value todo;
  33.   /* These are ephemerons which need to be marked and swept in the current
  34.      cycle. If the ephemeron is alive, after marking, they go into the live
  35.      list after cleaning them off the unreachable keys and releasing the data
  36.      if any of the keys are unreachable. */

  38.   value live;
  39.   /* These are ephemerons are alive (marked). The keys of these ephemerons may
  40.      be unmarked if these ephemerons were the target of a blit operation. The
  41.      data field is never unmarked. */

  43.   int must_sweep_ephe;
  44.   /* At the beginning of [Phase_sweep_ephe] the [live] list is moved to the
  45.      [todo] list since the ephemerons in the [live] list may contain unmarked
  46.      keys if the blit operation was performed in earlier phases
  47.      ([Phase_mark_final] or [Phase_sweep_and_mark_main]). This move is done
  48.      exactly once per major cycle per domain. This field keeps track of whether
  49.      this move has been done for the current cycle. */

  51.   uintnat cycle;
  52.   struct {
  53.     value* todop;
  54.     uintnat cycle;
  55.   } cursor;
  56. };

  58. /** The first field 0:  weak list;
  59.        second field 1:  data;
  60.        others       2..:  keys;

  62.     A weak pointer is an ephemeron with the data at caml_ephe_none
  63.     If fields are added, don't forget to update weak.ml, [additional_values],
  64.     and obj.ml, [Ephemeron.additional_values].


  67. */

  69. ‌#define CAML_EPHE_LINK_OFFSET 0
  70. ‌#define CAML_EPHE_DATA_OFFSET 1
  71. ‌#define CAML_EPHE_FIRST_KEY 2
  72. ‌#define CAML_EPHE_MAX_WOSIZE (Max_wosize - CAML_EPHE_FIRST_KEY)

  74. ‌#define Ephe_link(e) (*(Op_val(e) + CAML_EPHE_LINK_OFFSET))
  75. ‌#define Ephe_data(e) (*(Op_val(e) + CAML_EPHE_DATA_OFFSET))

  77. struct caml_ephe_info* caml_alloc_ephe_info (void);
  78. void caml_ephe_clean(value e);

  80. #endif /* CAML_INTERNALS */

  82. #ifdef __cplusplus
  83. }
  84. #endif

  86. #endif /* CAML_WEAK_H */
